projects.description: It's a random quote generator, which displays quotations on a page, and can be controlled by the user.

Full Stack JavaScript developers create forms to collect information from users for nearly every website and application they build. For this project, you’ll use your skills to enhance a form so that it’s engaging, interactive, and easy to use.

This project is both fun and a great way to show off your JavaScript skills -- you'll learn a lot more about JavaScript and working with the DOM, or Document Object Model. You'll also start using object-oriented programming (OOP) principles just like professional JavaScript developers.
In this project I wrote a program to better display a long list of student information.

In this unit I used JavaScript and AJAX to make a request of a public API, or Application Programming Interface. Many sites — Twitter, Facebook, IMDB, and Wikipedia to name a few — offer a vast sea of data that you can access and display on your own web pages. Using JavaScript, you’ll create an employee directory by communicating with a third-party API.
